snapshot.subject: As a user, I would like to see an 'About Defender' function

description_html:
Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement actions. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the formal enforcement data from FDA with less formal information from the broader internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Certainly consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information in this site.

snapshot.subject: As a user, I would like to view a map of affected areas based on my recalls.

description_html:
Defender will present on a map interface the affected geographical areas for a selected enforcement action.

Results:

  • related to US26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
  • location is based on API country and state data fields
  • within the last 30 calendar days from today
  • results should be for enforcement reports from Types: food, devices, and drugs

show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

Defender will present on a map interface the affected geographical areas for a selected enforcement action.

Results:

  • the map presentation is driven by data parsed from the distribution_pattern in the enforcement report
  • map provides a bubble-like view over affected states for US, and countries for non-US areas
  • bubbles are shaded and numbered to indicate total number of recalls for affected area
  • only show for date ranges less than 30 days

if no results are found, message 'good news, no affected areas!'

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

snapshot.subject: As a user, I would like to see the twitter feed applicable to my keyword.

description_html:
Defender includes Twitter activity related to data found in Open/FDA.

Response:
- by default Twitter data relating to 'Food Recall' is used
- if keyword is specified, Twitter data relating to keyword is used
- if specific report is viewed, Twitter data relating to product_description is used
- if Twitter has no response, relating Defender frames should say 'Nothing Trending on Twitter!'

history.comment: do the field lists change based on the type?

I suspect you were soliciting Bill's input here, but just in case it helps: since we are supposed to show ALL types in the same list by default, I would think the field lists need to be consistent.  In support of that, Steve W. determined yesterday that the _available_ fields for each type are identical.

description_html:
At completion I will see Open/FDA data on recalls in the last 30 days, for all types, elegantly summarized on a single page.

Field Names:
- product type
- reason for recall
- Voluntary?
- affected area (can delete the 1 point for affected area and add it here since it's really just showing another field?

  • provide sorting
  • limit number shown at one time to 50, show total # with number of pages

At completion I will see Open/FDA data on recalls in the last 30 days, for all types, elegantly summarized on a single page.

Results:
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- results should be for enforcement reports from food, devices, and drugs

Field Names:
- product type
- reason for recall
- Voluntary?
- affected area
- Classification

Other non-functional
- provide sorting ascending/descending
- limit number shown at one time to what works for design, show total # with number of pages
- option to navigation between pages of results
- provide expand all to see all results at one time
- zebra stripe rows

  • unit tests written and green
  • committed on server (as part of CI)
  • code review complete

snapshot.subject: As a user, I would like to refine/search by a time frame in order to see a larger scope of results.

history.comment:
a.	Search by Begin Date and End Date
Pure Search (not Display by)
Testing is more complex
From date less than To date
Records returned match what is in the database

Search by Begin Date and End Date
Pure Search (not Display by)
Testing is more complex (From date less than To date, records returned match what is in the database)

subject: As a user, I would like to refine/search by a time frame in order to see a larger scope of results.
As a user, I would like to refine/search by a time frame in order to see a specific scope of results.

description_html:
the Defender will present a refined set of data based on a given keyword or phrase provided by the
user.

- zebra stripe rows
- flat design

snapshot.subject: As a user, I would like to view a map of the recalls that have occurred in the last 30 days so that I can see where the recalls came from.

description_html:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types, on a map interface.

Results:

  • Related to US26, the query result is presented on a map interface
  • within the last 30 calendar days from today
  • results should be for enforcement reports from food, devices, and drugs

Field Names:
- Report date
- Classification
- Recalling firm
- Product Description
- Status

  • show nice error message if no results are found like "Opps, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing!"

Other non-functional
- limit number shown at one time to what works for design, show total # with number of pages
- option to navigation between pages of results
- zebra stripe rows
- flat design

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_html:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types, on a map interface.

  • related to US26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
  • location is based on API country and state data fields

- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- results should shall be distinguishable by type
- provide link to enforcement report if a single indicator is returned.
- provide grid view if multiple indications are returned
- visual indicators should be applicable by type (something like cow for food, stethoscope for device, pill for drug)

Business Rules:
- indicators shall be by state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US
- if >1 indicator for a state provide total number applicable to that state as one indicator for the entire state

- indicators shall be by country for non-US

show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

user_stories.description:
Defender includes Google Trends data related to data found in Open/FDA.

Response:
- as default, present Google Trends data relating to 'Food Recall'
- if keyword is specified, Google Trends data relating to the keyword string
- if specific report is viewed, Google Trends data relating to product_description parsed to not include superfluous details (weight, upc, etc.)
- include Google Trends responses for Interest Over Time, Regional Interests, and Related Searches
- for Interest Over Time, include News headlines
- for Regional Interest, default to worldwide view
- if Google Trends has no trends response, related Defender frames should say 'Nothing Trending on Google!'

snapshot.subject: As a system admin, I would like to be notified if there are issues with production.

description_html:
Setup default and custom monitors

Default:
CPU Alert - avg is more than 90% 15 mins
Network usage - outbound 5 MB for 3 reporting periods (15 mins)
Server downtime - down for more than 10 mins, send alarm

Custom actions - review through commands, not on cloud watch:
application up/down - more than 10 mins
application errors - capture all and log
application page hits - avg page server time

description_html:
Continuous monitoring metrics will be performed through Amazon cloudwatch. A combination of out of the box metrics and custom application metrics will be continuously monitored.

Application metrics which will be added include:
Application Up/Down status (alarm when down)
Number of page hits
Number of errors detected
Average Page Get Time (alarm when exceeds threshold)

description_diff:
Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project _**(Note 'open source project' should link to Defender's GitHub site)**_ created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement reports. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the more formal enforcement data from FDA with the less formal information from the broad internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick-glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? _**(not sure what the url is)**_ includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Defender is not for clinical use. For certain, always consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information found in this site.


- Add about link to header
- add logo for defender
- update footer for social media with icons and links
description_html:
Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project (Note 'open source project' should link to Defender's GitHub site) created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement reports. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the more formal enforcement data from FDA with the less formal information from the broad internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick-glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? (not sure what the url is) includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Defender is not for clinical use. For certain, always consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information found in this site.

  • Add about link to header
  • add logo for defender
  • update footer for social media with icons and links

Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project (Note 'open source project' should link to Defender's GitHub site) created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement reports. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the more formal enforcement data from FDA with the less formal information from the broad internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick-glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? (not sure what the url is) includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Defender is not for clinical use. For certain, always consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information found in this site.

description_diff:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 390 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- visual indicator for the food related enforcement


Business Rules:
- show indicator for every recall
- indicators shall be by city/state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US


show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_diff:
Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project _**(Note 'open source project' should link to Defender's GitHub site)**_ created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement reports. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the more formal enforcement data from FDA with the less formal information from the broad internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick-glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? _**(not sure what the url is)**_ includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Defender is not for clinical use. For certain, always consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information found in this site.


- Add about link to header
- add logo for defender
- update footer for social media with icons and links

description_diff:
Setup default and custom monitors

Default:
CPU Alert - avg is more than 90% 15 mins
Network usage - outbound 5 MB for 3 reporting periods (15 mins)
Server downtime - down for more than 10 mins, send alarm

Custom actions - review through commands, not on cloud watch:
application up/down - more than 10 mins
application errors - capture all and log
application page hits - avg page server time

Network usage - outbound 5 MB for 3 reporting periods (15 mins)

application errors - capture all and log
application page hits - avg page server time

description_diff:
the Defender will present a refined set of data based on a given keyword or phrase provided by the
user.

- keyword applicable to reason and product description field
- scope is allfood recall types
- dates are always set to 30 calendar days from today unless modified by a date refiner
- results should be refined and displayed in the summary view

- show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing!"

- add helper text with suggestion for key word search
-
Other non-functionals - for grid view
- limit number shown at one time to what works for design, show total # with number of pages
- option to navigation between pages of results
- zebra stripe rows
- flat design

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- include any steps needed

description_diff:
Continuous monitoring metrics will be performed through Amazon cloudwatch. A combination of out of the box metrics and custom application metrics will be continuously monitored.

Application metrics which will be added include:
Application Up/Down status (alarm when down)
Number of page hits
Number of errors detected
Average Page Get Time (alarm when exceeds threshold)
description_html:
Continuous monitoring metrics will be performed through Amazon cloudwatch. A combination of out of the box metrics and custom application metrics will be continuously monitored.

Application Up/Down status (alarm when down)
Number of page hits
Number of errors detected
Average Page Get Time (alarm when exceeds threshold)

description_diff:
Text to be associated with About Defender is:

Defender is an open source project _**(Note 'open source project' should link to Defender's GitHub site)**_ created by INTEGRITYOne Partners as a concept for the GSA/18F Agile Delivery Services challenge.

Defender combines information and presents a broader perspective to inform of current FDA enforcement reports. The idea is to provide a big picture utility that combines the more formal enforcement data from FDA with the less formal information from the broad internet community, toward an objective of creating a quick-glance ability to improve knowledge and awareness of these activities.

Caution: url.Defender.??? _**(not sure what the url is)**_ includes data and links to non-governmental organizations, websites and other resources. These resources are provided for informational purposes only. Defender is not for clinical use. For certain, always consult your physician and lawyer before taking action on information found in this site.

description_diff:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- visual indicator for the food related enforcement


Business Rules:
- show indicator for every recall
- indicators shall be by city/state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US


show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_diff:
Defender will allow user see 'more' data that is from the enforcement report.

Selecting a particular report entry from the summary grid, Defender will:

Fields:
- list all fields for a single enforcement report in a column format
- provide as separate entity for main viewing area - do as expansionsmodal
- provide navigation back to defender if needed based on design

 Design elements:
- get grid to fit in defined height
- modify border colors
- add titles/info text to the grid

Because the enforcement report includes distribution_pattern (affected areas) this US supersedes US44.

description_diff:
Defender will present on a map interface the affected geographical areas for a selected enforcement action.

Results:

- the map presentation is driven by data parsed from the distribution_pattern in the enforcement report
- map provides a bubble-like view over affected states for US, and countries for non-US areas
- bubbles are shaded and numbered to indicate total number of recalls for affected area
- only show for date ranges less than 30 days

if no results are found, message 'good news, no affected areas!'

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States


Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_diff:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- visual indicators should be applicable by type (something like cow for food, stethoscope for device, pill for drug)
- from the map, provide link to enforcement report if a single indicator is returned.
- from the map, provide grid view if multiple indications are returned

Business Rules:
- indicators shall be by state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US
- if >1 indicator for a state provide total number applicable to that state as one indicator for the entire state for the food related enforcement


Business Rules:
- show indicator for every recall
- indicators shall be by state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US

show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_diff:
Defender includes Google Trends data related to data found in Open/FDA.

Response:
- as default, present Google Trends data relating to 'Food Recall'
- if keyword is specified, Google Trends data relating to the keyword string
- if specific report is viewed, Google Trends data relating to product_description is parsed to not include superfluous details (weight, upc, etc.)
- include Google Trends responses for Interest Over Time, Regional Interests, and Related Searches
- for Interest Over Time, include News headlines
- for Regional Interest, default to worldwide view
- if Google Trends has no trends response, related Defender frames should say 'Nothing Trending on Google!'

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

description_diff:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- results should shall be distinguishable by type
-visual indicators should be applicable by type (something like cow for food, stethoscope for device, pill for drug)
- from the map, provide link to enforcement report if a single indicator is returned.
- from the map, provide grid view if multiple indications are returned
- visual indicators should be applicable by type (something like cow for food, stethoscope for device, pill for drug)

Business Rules:
- indicators shall be by state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US
- if >1 indicator for a state provide total number applicable to that state as one indicator for the entire state

show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient

- zebra stripe rows
- flat design

- zebra stripe rows
- flat design

description_diff:
Defender will present on a map interface the affected geographical areas for a selected enforcement action.

Results:

- related to US25, the map presentation is driven by data parsed from the distribution_pattern in the enforcement report

if no results are found, show a blank/generic map of the entire world.- map provides a bubble-like view over affected states for US, and countries for non-US areas
- bubbles are shaded and numbered to indicate total number of recalls for affected area
- only show for date ranges less than 30 days

if no results are found, message 'good news, no affected areas!'

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States

description_diff:
Defender will present Open/FDA data on recalls for the last 30 days, for all types distinguishable on a map interface.

Results:
- related to #26, the recalls are summarized on a map interface
- location is based on API 'country' and 'state' data fields
- within the last 30 calendar days from today
- results should be for enforcement reports from Types: food,shall be distinguishable by type
- provide link to enforcement report if a single indicator is returned.
- provide grid view if multiple indications are returned
- visual indicators should be applicable by type (something like cow for food, stethoscope for devices, and drugspill for drug)

Business Rules:
- indicators shall be by state within US
- indicators shall be by country for non-US
- if >1 indicator for a state provide total number applicable to that state as one indicator for the entire state

show nice error message if no results are found like "Oops, no recalls were found...wait, that's actually a good thing, have a look at our beautiful world!"

Other non-functional
- option to navigation between grid and map interface
- default scope of map is entire world
- map should allow user to zoom from entire world view to a finer view of the US, then to States


Keeping the code honest:
- unit tests written and green
- committed on server (as part of CI)
- code review complete

Monitoring:
- setup and determine if feedback from monitoring is sufficient
